_header: There is a body of a body
Note:
Printed Ashmole (1652)
XAshmole, Elias. Theatrum Chemicum Britannicum. London: J. Grimond, 1652, 434.
_description: ‘The Whole Science’ (alchemical verses) — ten or eleven lines in couplets

BodAsh1445.First Lines:
There ys a body of a bodyAnd a Saule & a spiryt
                    …
BodAsh1445.Last Lines:
…And all it cometh out of one kyndeMarke þis well man
                    & beare it in mynde

BLEge845.First Lines: Ther ys a body of a bodyAnd a Soul & a spyryt…
BLEge845.Last Lines: …And all yt comythe out of oon kyndeMarke this well man & bere yt in mynde

BLHar2407.First Lines: Ther ys a bodi of a bodiand a soule and a spryte…
BLHar2407.Last Lines: …and al hyt cometh owte of on lyndmarke thys wel man in thy mynd
BLHar2407.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.309.
